column4: TONS OF PEOPLE ON THE WEB SEEM TO BE LOOKING FOR THIS FILE IN .deb
I installed 2 programs which were both terrible compaired to irfanview.. one was gview (if i remember correctly) and another Xpaint
Could someone please help me install xnview?
Im surprised that this does not exist in a .deb file .. its such a cool program.
http://www.xnview.com/
I have tried to download the .deb.. they are all outdated or dont work. scarce.
Tried google .. not much .. out of date and / or not downloading properly
how so?
Statement from the xnview website: XnView is a free software to view, organise, convert graphics files.
it depends on their exact licensing. They may not be following the GPL.
grab the source and compile it perhaps.
thers also Picassa for Linux. :) (yes it uses wine so its a bit of a cheat but it works)
i just use mythtv. :) that way it zaps out the commercials.
i found it simple. :P
but im a leet-haxor-dude i guess.
the mythubuntu package makes it very easy to get going. :)
i installed myth tv and i dont know what the *#$)(*)#(* (insert preferred swear word here) is going on
the guys in #mythbuntu may know a more straight forward way to do it.
see above
i am RTFMing right now. :)
ok ;-) lol
looks like it has a few odd depenecies..  thats about it.. i dont even have a tv tuner card installed any more on my mythtv box
the main problem it says my dependency on specific kde thingy is wrong.
downloaded the .deb
upon installation it says it needs kdelibs4c2
but i only have  kdelibs4c2a and kdelibs4c2 is no longer in repos.. etc.
that deb is for an OLD OLD release of ubuntu
what to do?
use the source. recompile
can you help me make new deb?
can you help me recompile?
cool!
for a start i had to do a  sudo apt-get install kde-devel  qt3-dev-tools  qt3-apps-dev

sounds way advanced.. im a windows refugee.. so it has been challenging.. with this whole compile thing i dont know where to start... but thanks for helping .. legendary.. perhaps we should post the .deb to the site for future users
(when its done)
you may want to go read some of the mythty/mythbuntu docs/guides then - they are decently well done.   I dont even have a tv tuner card installed any more to test this thing once it does compile
you would proberly have better luck in posting to the kalva forums asking for a more recent deb.

its ok.. if you send me the .deb i can test it ;-) myth tv is not what i am looking for for the very reasons explained on the http://hafizpariabi.blogspot.com/2007/12/install-kalva-in-kubuntu-gutsy.html among others
but thanks
im not making a .deb - im just gettting the wouce to compile right now.
wouce?
i dont even know how to make a .deb :)
the source did compile. and kalva did run. so  i would say download the source.. get all the developer files you need.. and compile it.   -
oh, well if you manage to compile it.. please let me know how
i allready did..:) i downloaded the source. installed all the depenedneciues.. and did the normal ./configure, make, make isntall song and dance. :)
could you talk me through it?

proberly not in any great detail. i got 10000+ dev packages installed.. so you will proberly need to start grabbing the various dev packages .. and download the source for a start compiling it and see what else it wants
thanks.
how do i download source? is that the tar.bz2 package?
This may be a VERY long night for you. :)
yes.. thats the source
ok.
lol
need help.. kalva is perfect for my needs .. but for some reason;; IT REFUSES TO WORK ON MY SYSTEM!!!
so what do i do with the source now.

make a directory.. put the source in there. uncompress it..  read its readme/install docs.. and of course You should be installing the various -dev packages...  (ive think ive said about 10 min ago what i was installing) :) you may have to install quite a few things to get the thing tocompile.
for a start install the 'build-essential' package
for a start i had to do a  sudo apt-get install kde-devel  qt3-dev-tools  qt3-apps-dev
egads.. this is going to be a VERY VERY long night for you.
lol windows refugee remember. ;-)
you may want to spend an hr reading a few bash tutorials befor trying this compilation song and dance.
oh.. i have it onw
this MIGHT work --> http://rapidshare.com/files/90314282/kalva_0.8.90-1_i386.deb.html
thanks
and if it blows up your pc.. well --- too bad. :P
but could you possibly download that and email it to me .. as i dont have rapidshare account and free option never works for me

i think i already downloaded that
i dont even know where you left off.   :)
